did.abstract: School administrator, Regent of the University of Michigan, 1958-1966. Regental files, and materials collected relating to the history of Czech-Americans, especially Moravian-Americans, in Michigan.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Carl Brablec (donor no. 5335).

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Carl Brablec papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Carl Brablec was a graduate of Eastern Michigan University and the University of Michigan. He began his career as a teacher, then as principal and superintendent of schools in Britton and Clarkston. From 1947 to 1970, he was superintendent of the Roseville Community School District. In addition, from 1957 to 1966, Brablec served as a Regent of the University of Michigan.

scopecontent.p: The Brablec papers consist of materials accumulated in his role of University of Michigan regent and miscellaneous collected material relating to his interest in the history of Czech-American, especially Moravian-Americans, in Michigan.

Immigrants--Michigan.

note.p: (include some materials received after he left the board)

did.unittitle: Notebook containing survey of selected southeastern Michigan families of Moravian ancestry, ca. 1969-1971
Miscellaneous: include manuscripts, clippings and published material relating to the Czech-American community (particularly Moravian-Americans) in Michigan
